LAB2

Class Keyboard

  • java.lang.Object
    • LAB2.Keyboard
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Calculator, QWERTY

    public class Keyboard
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the super type keyboard that holds code and value of all the buttons-for the sub type keyboards- as a String data type. Also, provides the methods to get and manipulate the class variables.

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • Keyboard

        public Keyboard()
        Add the general buttons with their codes to the lists of buttons.

    • Method Detail

      • getButtonCodeIndex

        protected int getButtonCodeIndex(java.lang.String buttoncode)
        Takes the button code and looks for the index of that button in both stored arrays (buttonCodeList and buttonValueList).
        Parameters:
        buttoncode - The code of button which the user is looking for its value.
        Returns:
        The index of the button in the buttonCodeList and buttonValueList arrays.

      • buttonPressed

        protected void buttonPressed(java.lang.String buttoncode)
        This method calls the getButtonCodeIndex and passes the buttoncode. Then if the code is not found, the method returns without output. Otherwise, the method checks if the code for one of the general buttons. If the button pressed is not a general button, then the value of that button is added to the displayedText.
        Parameters:
        buttoncode - the code of the pressed button.

      • backspace

        protected void backspace()
        Deletes one character at the end of the displayedText.

      • space

        protected void space()
        Adds a space character at the end of the displayedText.

      • newLine

        protected void newLine()
        Jumps to a new line in the displayedText.

      • getAllButtonsValue

        protected java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getAllButtonsValue()
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of strings of buttons value (buttonValueList)

      • getAllButtonsCode

        protected java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getAllButtonsCode()
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of strings of buttons code (buttonCodeList)

      • getDisplayedText

        protected java.lang.String getDisplayedText()
        Returns:
        the string variable that stored the entered values (displayedText)
